In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

In Julia, you can use the Dates package to achieve this task. First, make sure to include the necessary packages. Then define your function like so:

```julia
using DataFrames
using Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
In this code, the function `add_yearmonth` takes a DataFrame as input. It creates a new column called `ym` which is equal to the year and month of each date in your DataFrame. The year and month are obtained using the `year` and `month` functions from the Dates package respectively. 

Then, you can call this function like so:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=Dates.Date[2000,1,2003,4], x=[1,2,3,4])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
